alert.note: Alert for Marion (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 12 at 1:23PM EDT until August 12 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Marion County in north central Ohio... * Until 200 PM EDT. * At 122 PM EDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Morral, or near Marion, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters and law enforement confirmed tornado near Marion. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * The tornado will be near... Marion around 135 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Caledonia. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
